author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) and the [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name is not at least 5 characters long
- The following dependencies do not have a `[compat]` entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of breaking releases: DataFrames
- Package name similar to 11 existing packages.
  <details>
  <summary>Similar package names</summary>

  1. Similar to Jin. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 is at or below cutoff of 2. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 between lowercased names is at or below cutoff of 1. Normalized visual distance 0.84 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
  2. Similar to Bio. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  3. Similar to JLD. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  4. Similar to Air. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  5. Similar to Git. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  6. Similar to Amb. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  7. Similar to Jive. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  8. Similar to Libz. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  9. Similar to JDF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  10. Similar to JET. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  11. Similar to FIB. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 between lowercased names is at or below cutoff of 1.

  </details>


Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simply retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. Then, send a message to the `#pkg-registration` channel in the [Julia Slack](https://julialang.org/slack/) to ask for help. Include a link to this pull request.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
Though unregistered, the package has been around for quite some time and I'd find it rather inconvenient to change the name at this stage.

> I'd find it rather inconvenient to change the name at this stage

Sorry, but that's not a convincing argument. `Jib` really isn't a suitable name for a Julia package. Not only is "IB" jargon, the "J" is also for "Julia", and we strongly discourage the "Julia" prefix/suffix for Julia packages (except for some very special cases).

Note that you can write

```
using InteractiveBrokers: InteractiveBrokers as Jib
```

in any existing code (and yes, it would be nice if in some future version of Julia that could be written as `using InteractiveBrokers as Jib`)

That's fair.
I'm not trying to convince anybody or build a case.

Registration has not been a priority of mine but since some user suggested it I thought I'd give it a try.

Feel free to disregard this request.

There is also the option of putting it in a [`LocalRegistry`](https://github.com/GunnarFarneback/LocalRegistry.jl), which will alleviate most of the problems with unregistered packages, except for "packages in General can only have dependencies that are also in General". If that ever becomes the problem, I think you'll have to rename, unfortunately.

> that's not a convincing argument

If you wanted to try a slightly more convincing argument, it would be "I also have `rib` for the R-version of this package, and I'd like to keep a consistent name". But a 3-letter package name is just going to be an extremely tough sell.

> Feel free to disregard this request.

Alright, I'm going to close this here, but don't hesitate to try again in the future. At least with a more suitable name, this package would be more than welcome in General.

body:
- Registering package: Jib
- Repository: https://github.com/lbilli/Jib.jl

- Description: A Julia implementation of Interactive Brokers API
title: New package: Jib v0.20.4
